melting.patternModels.singleMismatch

Class ZnoskoMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • melting.patternModels.PatternComputation
      • melting.patternModels.singleMismatch.ZnoskoMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PatternComputationMethod
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Znosko07mm, Znosko08mm

    public abstract class ZnoskoMethod
extends PatternComputation
    This class represents the single mismatch model from Znosco et al, 2007, 2008. It extends PatternComputation.

    • Method Detail

      • isApplicable

        public boolean isApplicable(Environment environment,
                   int pos1,
                   int pos2)
        Specified by:
        isApplicable in interface PatternComputationMethod
        Overrides:
        isApplicable in class PatternComputation
        Returns:
        false if the model used to compute the enthalpy and entropy of the pattern at the positions pos1 and pos2 is not applicable with the environment. If the environment can make the results less reliable, a warning message will appear.

      • computeThermodynamics

        public ThermoResult computeThermodynamics(NucleotidSequences sequences,
                                 int pos1,
                                 int pos2,
                                 ThermoResult result)
        Specified by:
        computeThermodynamics in interface PatternComputationMethod
        Specified by:
        computeThermodynamics in class PatternComputation
        Parameters:
        sequences - which contains the sequences entered by the user.
        result - which contains the computed enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature.
        Returns:
        ThermoResult result which contains the incremented enthalpy and entropy values.

      • isMissingParameters

        public boolean isMissingParameters(NucleotidSequences sequences,
                          int pos1,
                          int pos2)
        Description copied from interface: PatternComputationMethod
        Check if one thermodynamic parameter is missing to compute the enthalpy and entropy of the pattern at the positions pos1 and pos2.
        Specified by:
        isMissingParameters in interface PatternComputationMethod
        Overrides:
        isMissingParameters in class PatternComputation
        Parameters:
        sequences - which contains the sequences entered by the user.
        Returns:
        false if one necessary thermodynamic parameter is missing.

      • correctPositions

        protected int[] correctPositions(int pos1,
                     int pos2,
                     int duplexLength)
        corrects the pattern positions in the duplex to have the adjacent base pair of the pattern included in the subsequence between the positions pos1 and pos2
        Parameters:
        pos1 - : starting position of the internal loop
        pos2 - : ending position of the internal loop
        duplexLength - : total length of the duplex
        Returns:
        int [] positions : new positions of the subsequence to have the pattern surrounded by the adjacent base pairs in the duplex.
